verses.roman:
ataeva kahi kichu kariñā nigūḍha
bujhibe rasika bhakta, nā bujhibe mūḍha

synonyms: ataeva—therefore; kahi—I speak; kichu—something; kariñā—squeezing; nigūḍha—essence; bujhibe—can understand; rasika—humorous; bhakta—devotees; nā—not; bujhibe—will understand; mūḍha—rascals.
translation: Therefore I shall mention them, revealing only their essence, so that loving devotees will understand them but fools will not.
